Overload.descr: Arcus cosine of x
Returns the date occurring n months after startdate or, if n is negative, the date occurring n months before startdate
Returns the date occurring n years after startdate or, if n is negative, the date occurring n years before startdate
Returns the age at the time of timestamp (in completed years) of somebody born on date_of_birth
Returns the first of the parameters that has a valid number representation. If none is found the else will be returned
Applies a different codepage to the field or text stated in the expression
Used for mapping any expression to a previously loaded mapping table
Returns the color representation of a color defined by the red component e1, the green component e2 and the blue component e3 with an alpha factor (opacity) of alpha
Arcus sine of x
Arcus tangent of x
Two-dimensional generalization of the arcus tangent function. Returns the angle between the origin and the point represented by the coordinates x and y
Returns the value of the meta tags of different file formats, e.g. MP3, WMA, WMV and JPG files, as text
Returns the author of the current document
Returns a unique integer value for each distinct evaluated value of expression encountered during the script execution
Calculates a 128-bit hash of the combined input expression values and the returns a unique integer value for each distinct hash value encountered during the script execution
Calculates a 256-bit hash of the combined input expression values and the returns a unique integer value for each distinct hash value encountered during the script execution
Returns the average of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the number of set bits in i. Where i is interpreted as a signed 64-bit integer, though only the first 48 bits are significant
Returns the RGB color representation for black (RGB 0,0,0).
Calculates the theoretical value of an option returning the value according to the Black and Schole unmodified formula (European style options)
Returns the RGB color representation for blue (RGB 0,0,128)
Returns the RGB color representation for brown (RGB 128,128,0)
Returns the string s with all words capitalized
Rounding of x upwards to the nearest multiple of base with an offset of offset
Returns the aggregated chi2-test value for one or two series of values iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the aggregated chi2-test df value (degrees of freedom) for one or two series of values iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the aggregated chi2-test p value (significance) for one or two series of values iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the one-tailed probability of the chi2 distribution
Returns the inverse of the one-tailed probability of the chi2 distribution
The character corresponding to number n in ASCII (1-127), ANSI (128-255) or Unicode (256 and above)
Creates a classification of expressions. The bin width is determined by the number set as interval
Returns the name of the platform the client is using
This function returns the color representation of color number n in the relevant chart palette
Returns an RGB color representation from a two color gradient, based on a value between 0 and 1
Returns an RGB color representation from a two color gradient with the possibility to specify an intermediate color for the center position, based on a value between -1 and 1
Returns the number of combinations of n2 items that can be picked from a group of n1 items. The order in which the items are selected is insignificant
Returns a string containing the name of the computer as returned by the operating system
Returns the aggregated string concatenation of all values of expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the active connect string for ODBC or OLE DB connection
Converts a UTC or GMT timestamp to local time as a dual value

Returns the aggregated correlation coefficient for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Cosine of x
Cosine hyberbolicus of x
Returns the count of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the RGB color representation for cyan (RGB 0,128,128)
Returns the RGB color representation for dark gray (RGB 128,128,128)
Formats the expression as a date according to the string given as format-code
Evaluates the expression as a date according to the string given as format-code
Returns an integer representing the day when date is interpreted as a date
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the last millisecond of the day contained in timestamp
Returns the current adjustment for daylight saving time, as defined in Windows
Returns a display value showing the date with an underlying numeric value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the day containing timestamp
Returns the day number of the quarter according to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the first day of the quarter containing date
Returns the day number of the year according to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the first day of the year containing date
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the day contained in timestamp
Integer division. Both parameters are interpreted as real numbers, i.e. they do not have to be integers
Returns a string containing the name of the current QlikView document, without path but with extension
Returns a string containing the full path to the current QlikView document
Returns a string containing the title of the current QlikView document
Forced association of an arbitrary string representation s with a given number representation x
Base of the natural logarithms, e. The function returns 2.71828...
If the text string s can be evaluated as a valid QlikView expression, the evaluated result of the expression will be returned
Returns true if n is an even integer, false if n is an odd integer and NULL if n is not an integer
Determines whether a specific field value exists in a specified field of the data loaded so far
Exponential function, with the base of the natural logarithm e as base
The absolute value of x. The result is a positive number
Returns the factorial of a positive integer n. If the number n is not an integer it will be truncated.
Returns a dual value with text value 'false' and numeric value 0, which can be used as logical false in expressions
Returns the position of the field value value found in the field fieldname (by load order)
Returns the name of the field with the specified number within a previously loaded table
Returns the number of a specified field within a previously loaded table
Returns the field value found in position n of the field fieldname (by load order)
Returns the number of distinct values in a field
Returns a string containing the name of the table file currently being read, without path or extension
Returns a string containing the path to the directory of the table file currently being read
Returns a string containing the extension of the table file currently being read
Returns a string containing the name of the table file currently being read, without path but including the extension
Returns a string containing the full path to the table file currently being read
Returns an integer containing the size in bytes of the file filename or, if no filename is specified, of the table file currently being read
Returns a timestamp for the date and time of the last modification of the file filename. If no filename is specified, the function will refer to the currently read table file
Returns the position of the n:th occurrence in the string text of any of the characters found in the string characterset
Returns the first value of expression sorted by corresponding sort-weight when expression is iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the first value in load order of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the latest starting date to achieve number_of_workdays (Monday-Friday) ending no later than end_date taking into account any optionally listed holidays
Rounding of x downwards to the nearest multiple of base with an offset of offset
Generalized modula function. Both parameters are interpreted as real numbers, i.e. they do not have to be integers
Returns the fraction part of x
Returns the fractile of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the value of a named extended property in the sheet object with the given object id
Returns the value of the Microsoft Windows SHGetFolderPath function and returns the path for e.g. MyMusic
Returns the name of the dimension
Returns the value of a named registry key with a given registry path
Returns the current Greenwich Mean Time, as derived from the system clock and Windows time settings
Returns the RGB color representation for green (RGB 0,128,0)
Returns a 128-bit hash of the combined input expression values
Returns a 160-bit hash of the combined input expression values
Returns a 256-bit hash of the combined input expression values
Returns an integer representing the hour when the fraction of time is interpreted as a time
Returns the color representation of a color defined by a hue between 0 and 1, a saturation value between 0 and 1 and a luminosity value between 0 and 1
If the expression condition is true, the expression then will be performed, otherwise the expression else will be performed
Returns true if timestamp lies inside the day containing basetimestamp
Returns true if timestamp lies inside the part of day containing basetimestamp up until and including the exact millisecond of basetimestamp
Position of a substring. This function gives the starting position of the n:th occurrence of substring s2 in string s1
Returns true if date lies inside the lunar week (consecutive 7 day periods starting on January 1st each year) containing basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the part of lunar week (consecutive 7 day periods starting on January 1st each year) containing basedate up until and including the last millisecond of basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the month containing basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the n month shift (aligned from January 1st) containing basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the part of the n month period (aligned from January 1st) containing basedate up until and including the last millisecond of basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the part of month containing basedate up until and including the last millisecond of basedate
This function can be used in the script only and opens an input box that prompts the user for a value during the script execution
Returns true if date lies inside the quarter containing basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the part of the quarter containing basedate up until and including the last millisecond of basedate
Formats the expression as a time interval according to the string given as a format-code
Evaluates the expression as a time interval according to the string given as a format-code
Returns true if date lies inside the week containing basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the part of week containing basedate up until and including the last millisecond of basedate
Returns true if date lies inside the year containing basedate. The year can be offset by shift
Returns true if date lies inside the part of year containing basedate up until and including the last millisecond of basedate
Returns -1 (true) if expr returns NULL, otherwise 0 (false)
Returns -1 (true) if the expression can be interpreted as a number, otherwise 0 (false)
Returns - 1 (true) if the current reload is partial, otherwise 0 (false)
Returns -1 (true) if the expression has a text representation, otherwise 0 (false)
Returns an integer indicating for which time one single record is evaluated in a load statement with a while clause
Returns the string s1 less all characters not contained in string s2
Returns the kurtosis of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the last value in load order of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the earliest ending date to achieve number_of_workdays (Monday-Friday) if starting at start_date taking into account any optionally listed holidays
Substring of the string s. The result is a string consisting of the first n characters of s
Length of string s. The result is an integer
Returns the RGB color representation for light blue (RGB 0,0,255)
Returns the RGB color representation for light cyan (RGB 0,255,255)
Returns the RGB color representation for light gray (RGB 192,192,192)
Returns the RGB color representation for light green (RGB 0,255,0)
Returns the RGB color representation for magenta (RGB 255,0,255)
Returns the RGB color representation for light red (RGB 255,0,0)

Returns the aggregated b value (y-intercept) of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated degrees of freedom of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated F statistic (r2/(1-r2)) of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

Returns the aggregated m value (slope) of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated r2 value (coefficient of determination) of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated standard error of the b value of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated standard error of the m value of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated standard error of the y estimate of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated regression sum of squares of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

returns the aggregated residual sum of squares of a linear regression defined by the equation y=mx+b for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns a timestamp of the current time from the system clock for a specified time zone.
The natural logarithm of x. The function is only defined if x > 0
The 10-logarithm (base 10) of x. The function is only defined if x > 0
Returns the value of fieldname corresponding to the first occurrence of the value matchfieldvalue in the field matchfieldname
Forces lower case for all data in the string
Returns the string s trimmed of any leading spaces
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the last millisecond of the lunar week (consecutive 7 day periods starting on January 1st each year) containing date

Returns a display value showing the year and week number with an underlying numeric value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the first date of the lunar week (consecutive 7 day periods starting on January 1st each year)containing date
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the lunar week (consecutive 7 day periods starting on January 1st each year) containing date
Returns the RGB color representation for magenta (RGB 128,0,128)
Returns a date calculated from the year YYYY, the month MM and the day DD
Returns a time calculated from the hour hh, the minute mm the second ss with a fraction fff down to a millisecond
Returns a date calculated from the year YYYY, the week WW and the day-of-week D
This function can be used for mapping parts of any expression on a previously loaded mapping table. The mapping is case sensitive and non-recursive
The match function performs a case sensitive comparison
Returns the maximum numeric value of expression encountered over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the last text value of expression over a number of records, as defined by a group by clause
returns the aggregated median of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Substring of the string s. The result is the string starting at character n1 with the length of n2 characters
Returns the minimum numeric value of expression encountered over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the first text value of expression over a number of records, as defined by a group by clause
Returns an integer representing the minute when the fraction of time is interpreted as a time
Returns the missing count of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
The mixmatch function performs a case insensitive comparison
Mathematical modula function. Both parameters must have integer values. x2 must be greater than 0
Returns the mode value, i.e. the most commonly occurring value, of expression over a number of records, as defined by a group by clause
Formats the expression numerically according to the string given as format-code
Evaluates the expression numerically according to the string given as format-code. Decimal separator and thousands separator can be set as third and fourth parameters
Returns a dual value representing the month when date is interpreted as a date
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the last millisecond of the last date of the month containing date
Returns a display value showing the month and year with an underlying numeric value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the first date of the month
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the last millisecond of the n month period (starting from January 1st) containing date

Returns a display value showing the months of the period and year with an underlying numeric value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the n month period (starting from January 1st) containing date
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the n month period (starting from January 1st) containing date
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the first date of the month containing date
This function can be used in the script only and opens a message box during the script execution
Returns the number of working days (Monday-Friday) between and including start_date and end_date taking into account any optionally listed holidays
Returns the number of fields in a previously loaded table
Returns the number of reports in the active document
Returns the number of rows (records) in a previously loaded table
Returns the number of tables previously loaded
Returns the cumulative normal distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation
Returns the inverse of the normal cumulative distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation
Returns a timestamp of the current time from the system clock
Returns the number of periods for an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate
Returns a real NULL value.
Returns the NULL count of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Formats the expression numerically according to the string given as format-code
Evaluates the expression numerically according to the string given as format-code
!Obsolete, use RangeAvg function! Returns the numeric average of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned.
!Obsolete, use RangeCount function! Returns the number of numeric values found in 1 to N arguments
Returns the numeric count of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
!Obsolete, use RangeMax function! Returns the lowest numeric value of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
!Obsolete, use RangeMin function! Returns the lowest numeric value of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
!Obsolete, use RangeSum function! Returns the numeric sum of 1 to N arguments. As opposed to the + operator, numsum will treat all non-numeric values as 0
Returns true if n is an odd integer, false if n is an even integer and NULL if n is not an integer.
If expression over a number of records, as defined by a group by clause, contains only one value, that value is returned
ASCII number of first character of string s. The result is an integer
Returns a string containing the name of the current user as returned by the operating system
Returns the contents of the fieldname in the record specified by row in the internal table tablename
Returns the number of permutations of n2 items that can be selected from a group of n1 items. The order in which the items are selected is significant.
The function returns p. 3.14159...
Returns the n:th expression in the list
Returns the payment for a loan based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate
Returns x to the power of y
Returns the value of expression using data from the previous input record that was not discarded due to a where clause
Returns the string s1 less all characters contained in string s2
Returns the present value of an investment
Returns the RGB color representation for QT blue (RGB 8,18,90)
Returns the RGB color representation for QT gray (RGB 158,148,137)
Returns the full QlikView version and build number (e.g. 7.52.3797.0409.3) as a string
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the last millisecond of the quarter containing date
Returns a display value showing the months of the quarter and year with an underlying numeric value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the first date of the quarter
Returns a value corresponding to a timestamp with the first millisecond of the quarter containing date
Returns the XML-header time stamp from a QVD file if any (otherwise NULL)
Returns the name of field number fieldno, if it exists in a QVD file (otherwise NULL)
Returns the number of fields in a QVD file
Returns the number of records currently in a QVD file
Returns the name of the table contained in a QVD file
Returns a string containing the name of the current QlikView user as entered in a section access
Returns a random number between 0 and 1
Returns the average of a range of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Returns the correlation coefficient for a series of coordinates
Returns the number of values found within a range of 1 to N arguments. NULL values are not counted
Returns the fractile within a range of 1 to N arguments.
Returns the internal rate of return for a series of cash flows represented by the numbers in values
Returns the kurtosis within a range of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Returns the highest numeric value found within a range 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Returns the last value in text sort order found among 1 to N arguments
Returns the lowest numeric value found within a range 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Returns the first value in text sort order found among 1 to N arguments
Returns the number of non-numeric values (including NULL values) found among 1 to N arguments
Returns the mode value, i.e. the most commonly occurring value within a range of 1 to N arguments
Returns the net present value of an investment based on a discount rate and a series of future payments (negative values) and incomes (positive values)
Returns the number of NULL values found within a range of 1 to N arguments
Returns the number of numeric values found within a range of 1 to N arguments
If exactly one non-NULL value exists among the range of N expressions, that value will be returned
Returns the skewness within a range of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Returns the standard deviation found within a range of 1 to N arguments. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Returns the sum of a range of 1 to N arguments. As opposed to the + operator, it treats all non-numeric values as 0
Returns the number of text values found within a range of 1 to N arguments
Returns the internal rate of return for a schedule of cash flows that is not necessarily periodic
Returns the net present value for a schedule of cash flows that is not necessarily periodic
Returns the interest rate per period on annuity. The result has a default number format of Fix two decimals and %
Returns an integer for the number of the currently read row of the raw source table data
Returns the RGB color representation for red (RGB 128,0,0)
Returns a timestamp for when the script last finished reexecuting
Forms a string consisting of the string s repeated n times
Returns a string after replacing all occurrences of a given substring within the string s with another substring
Returns the comment of the report with the specified number within the active document.
Returns the id of the report with the specified number within the active document
Returns the name of the report with the specified number within the active document
Returns the number of the report with the specified id or name within the active document
Returns the color representation of a color defined by the red component e1, the green component e2 and the blue component e3
Substring of the string s. The result is a string consisting of the last n characters of s.
Rounding of x upwards or downwards n number of steps with an offset of offset
Returns an integer for the position of the current row in the resulting QlikView internal table
Returns the string s trailing of any leading spaces
Returns an integer representing the second when the fraction of time is interpreted as a time
Returns a timestamp based on timestamp but with the year replaced with year
Returns a timestamp based on timestamp but with the year replaced with year and the month replaced with month
Returns 1, 0 or -1 depending on whether x is a number, 0 or a negative number. If no numeric value is found, NULL is returned
Sine of x
Sine hyberbolicus of x
Returns the skewness of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Square of x
Square root of x. The function is only defined if x >= 0
Returns the standard deviation of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the aggregated standard error (stdev/sqrt(n)) for a series of values represented by expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

Returns the aggregated standard error of the predicted y-value for each x-value in the regression for a series of coordinates represented by paired numbers in x-expression and y-expression iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
2-parameter version: generates one record for each substring that can be taken from a larger string s with the delimiter 'delimiter'
3-parameter version: returns a given substring defined by index from a larger string s using delimiter 'delimiter'
Returns the number of times the string substring appears within the string text
Returns the sum of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Returns the RGB color representation for the Windows system color nr, where nr corresponds to the parameter to the Windows API function GetSysColor(nr)
Returns the name of the table with the specified number
Returns the number of the specified table
Tangent of x
Tangent hyberbolicus of x
Returns the probability for the Student t-distribution where a numeric value is a calculated value of t for which the probability is to be computed
Forces the expression to be treated as text, even if a numeric interpretation is possible
Returns the text between the n:th occurrence of beforetext and the immediately following occurrence of aftertext within the string s
Returns the text count of expression over a number of records as defined by a group by clause
Formats the expression as a time according to the string given as format-code
Evaluates the expression as a time according to the string given as format-code
Formats the expression as a timestamp according to the string given as format-code
Evaluates the expression as a timestamp according to the string given as format-code
Returns the name of the current time zone, as defined in Windows
Returns the t-value of the Student's t-distribution as a function of the probability and the degrees of freedom
Returns the current date from the system clock
Returns the string s trimmed of any leading and trailing spaces
Returns a dual value with text value 'true' and numeric value -1, which can be used as logical true in expressions
Returns the aggregated t value for two independent series of values iterated over a number of records as defined by a group by clause

Returns the current Coordinated Universal Time

Provides compatibility with QV version 5. Performs a case insensitive comparison and permits the use of wildcard characters ( * and ?) in the comparison strings

Returns true if a date falls within the year to date, else false
